depthfunction.name: tukey
Tukey Depth
depthfunction.definition: The Tukey depth of a point $p$ wrt a set $S$ is \[ \min\{ |h\cap S| : \mbox{$h$ is a closed halfspace that contains $p$} \} \enspace . \]
depthfunction.mediangen: The median is the point of maximum Tukey depth in \mathbb{R}^1$.
depthfunction.breakdown: Moving less than $|S|/(d+1)$ points of $S$ will not cause the Tukey to leave the convex hull of $S$ (in $\mathbb{R}^d$).
depthfunction.centerpoint: For any point set $S\in\mathbb{R}^d$, $|S|=n$, there exists a point $p$ whose Tukey depth, wrt $S$ is at least $n/(d+1)$.
depthfunction.converges: For a sufficiently large random sample of $S'\subseteq S$, the Tukey depth of $p$ wrt $S'$ is proportional to the Tukey depth of $p$ wrt $S$.

algorithms.alg-compute: The Tukey depth of a point $p\in\mathbb{R}^2$ can be computed in $O(n\log n)$ time by radially sorting the points around $p$ (and this is optimal).
algorithms.alg-centerpoint: In $\mathbb{R}^2$, there exists a linear-time algorithm to find a point of Tukey depth at least $n/3$
algorithms.alg-contour: An individual Tukey contour has size $O(n)$ and can be computed in $O(n\log^2 n)$ time.
algorithms.alg-center: In $\mathbb{R}^2$, there exists an $O(n\log n)$ time algorithm to compute the point of maximum Tukey depth \cite{chanXX}.
algorithms.alg-depthmap: All $O(n)$ contours have total size $O(n^2)$ and can be computed in $O(n^2)$ time.
